its a little dishonest to compare stocktons scoring efficiency to currys without taking volume into account in stocktons peak efg year he averaged 147 ppg 217 per 100 possession if you want to adjust for pace in stephs peak efg year he averaged 30 ppg and 425 per 100 he literally scored twice a much on better efficiency i also think efg is an odd choice why not true shooting its more sensible to compare stocktons efficiency to other passfirst point guard like nash and cp3 but again their respective scoring output both at their peak and for their career significantly outpaces stocktons now stocktons lower scoring responsibility dont rule him out a an alltime great but if youre going to make a comparison about efficiency you have to include volume its only half the picture honestly i think the single biggest argument against stockton a the goat pg is that he wa never close to being the best player in the league the highest he ever finished in mvp voting wa 7th and he wa only in the top 10 4 time of the player you compared him to three are multipletime winner with further top 510 finish and cp3 ha finished in the top 10 9 time and the top 5 5 time over a significant sample size that rule out 12 year blip this is a pretty good shorthand for the highlevel impact that make a goat candidate losing out on mvp a few time is one thing voter make mistake but a guy with stocktons longevity never being able to break into that top tier is more telling you dont have to even look at the playoff to see that he simply wasnt on that level

the fact that stockton wa never close to winning an mvp a you point out is one of the strongest argument against his inclusion in a top 10 overall or even top 5 pg list this line of argument carry over to just his defensive presence a well  his career steal number are insane but he wa never 1st team defense and he wa only 2nd team defense 5 time the gary paytons and jason kidds of the world were unambiguously better defender in their respective prime

malone is also top 10 of all time at a certain point that just becomes ridiculous stockton wa never considered the best pg in the league now that kind of consideration might be over impacted by ppg person watching him say thats the best guy in the nba and that wa the era of anonymous voting which resulted in a lot of homerism in the voting  there a reason a unanimous mvp happened only when that anonymity wa removed dollar to donut that vote came from a utah press guy who wa doing a favor for the team not because he objectively thought stockton wa the best player that year when team played i mean stockton is universally seen a an all time great so you dont really need to make a case for it i dont agree with him being underrated though hes one of those guy that everyone call underrated so he cant actually be underrated honestly i think his stats have actually lead to him being overrated at the very least calling him the greatest pg ever or a top 10 player ever is absurd and significantly overrating him the simplest argument is that he wa never a top 5 mvp caliber player in the league karl malone wa always the best player on the jazz and i doubt you have malone in the top 10 or on in the conversation with tim duncan even if you incorrectly think stockton  malone youre telling me the greatest pg ever can play with karl malone his entire career and have more first round exit than conference final appearance and if you take a more in depth look at stockton playoff career there is a lot of rough moment for stockton especially if youre holding him to the standard of the greatest pgtop 10 player ever looking at this analysis youre just putting far too much stock into number this go without saying but having better number doesnt make you better even if i hard disagree with stockton being a better passer than magic i can see a case to be made but if youre gonna make that argument you gotta go more in depth than just looking at assist number you touched on his efficient scoring and it true that stockton wa efficient but that doesnt mean he wa a good scorer because he definitely wasnt he could have a good scoring game here and there but thats really it only ha 2 playoff game with 30 point in his career his scoring is nothing to gas up at all in fact you could say it wa a weakness all of that isnt to say he not a great player his longevity wa something to behold and he is one of the toughest player out there even though i said he had a lot of rough playoff moment he also had some great clutch moment too very humble player a well

my husband favorite wa pan am when they went out of business he wa flying back from leave in the us to his base in west berlin he had a stop in london where he wasnt supposed to get off the plane but hed never been to london he decided to play dumb grunt and get off the plane anyway then catch a later pan am flight this wa in either 89 or 90 so security wasnt a big issue he didnt have to be back on base for a good 24 hour he spent a happy day in london sight seeing a much a possible then went back to the airport ready to throw himself on the mercy of the pan am gate agent he get to his gate and there is a big empty space where the pan am sign had been in a panic he head for the lufthansa gate in vain hope that they will help a poor dumb infantryman get back to west berlin and avoid being awol their agent tell him that there might be a few pan am employee at gatwick my husband had just enough money to get a shuttle to gatwick he wa in a state of near panic on the entire ride just certain he going to jail remember child this wa the day before everyone had a cellphone and internet as he going into the terminal at gatwick he see a man in a blazer who who ha a pan am lapel pin turns out he just found the last pan am employee at gatwick the employee is happy to help my husband get his dumb as back to base  he took him to a lufthansa gate agent and signed his ticket over to get him on the next available flight to west berlin my husband made it back with hour to spare and a never dying love for a defunct airline i like to give him a hard time about how none of this would have happened if hed have just stayed on the damn plane like a normal person he say that seeing london and having a great story to tell make it worth it

my husband favorite wa pan am when they went out of business he wa flying back from leave in the us to his base in west berlin he had a stop in london where he wasnt supposed to get off the plane but hed never been to london he decided to play dumb grunt and get off the plane anyway then catch a later pan am flight this wa in either 89 or 90 so security wasnt a big issue he didnt have to be back on base for a good 24 hour he spent a happy day in london sight seeing a much a possible then went back to the airport ready to throw himself on the mercy of the pan am gate agent he get to his gate and there is a big empty space where the pan am sign had been in a panic he head for the lufthansa gate in vain hope that they will help a poor dumb infantryman get back to west berlin and avoid being awol their agent tell him that there might be a few pan am employee at gatwick my husband had just enough money to get a shuttle to gatwick he wa in a state of near panic on the entire ride just certain he going to jail remember child this wa the day before everyone had a cellphone and internet as he going into the terminal at gatwick he see a man in a blazer who who ha a pan am lapel pin turns out he just found the last pan am employee at gatwick the employee is happy to help my husband get his dumb as back to base  he took him to a lufthansa gate agent and signed his ticket over to get him on the next available flight to west berlin my husband made it back with hour to spare and a never dying love for a defunct airline i like to give him a hard time about how none of this would have happened if hed have just stayed on the damn plane like a normal person he say that seeing london and having a great story to tell make it worth it

people react differently to caffeine under exercise condition i would suggest trying some preworkout product that contain caffeine and other amino acid that help to enhance mental performance too the research say 300mg of caffeine is the sweet spot for physical cognitive and mental optimisation but there are many factor in this tolerance individual response etc

i dont know your squash level and your caffeine tolerance but a word of warning getting a little bit of caffeine before a match is not necessarily bad a in a couple of sip of coffee if you drink a lot of coffee you might be able to up this to maybe a full coffee your average heart rate will increase by 530 bpm depending of how much coffee you drank your max heart rate doe not change you will feel in the zone a long a you are not having hard rally where you would regularly hit your max heart rate you tend to go harder on every shot so you can overexert yourself and sweat more because of all the reason before you can end up with massively reduced performance at the end of a hard match due to overexertion andor dehydration if you have to have it make sure that you really pace it as in 1 sip before each match or something like that if you drink a full can of red bull before a match make sure to have a doctor nearby

never ever rely on them  they only improve your ability they dont give you new one so if you rely on the drink you slowly lose the ability to play without them half a can maximum once every 4th session maximum the reason they get such a bad rep is that people use them in place of coffee or just a a drink without actually burning any of the energy but do some googling theyre actually not that bad for you assuming youre doing intense cardio guaranteed with squash and youre consuming in moderation

i dabbled with them a a performanceaid or ade earlier this century redbull really is the best of what wa available at that time it work but it a slippery slope to using them regularly i still have a 89yr old can in the fridge for emergency ie earthquakevolcano disaster where i might need it benefit

i have always liked energy drink for playing softball baseball not squash and for upper end league match i definitely notice the difference now that said you do need to be careful how much you consume it will take me 5 or 6 softball game to go through a 5 hour energy im also a fan of v8 energy but again it exceedingly rare that i would finish even half a can dont underestimate the value of proper eating also and it should start early in the day with eating more veg if you have a blender a balanced smoothie with high energy fruit blueberry apple and some veg  believe it or not good lettuce is good in a smoothie broccoli is good but give a strong flavor kale etc usually about an hour to 30 minute before match will make a surprising difference in your energy
energy drink and hard sport should never ever be mixed usually lead to tachycardia

for me i find it i have caffeine in a lot more concentrated so my drop and volley increase in quality but i also find i tend to over think thing and so im worse at reading my opponent which i am usually very good at i also find my movement become more clunky and feel alot more tiring also make me more sweaty a with you so i tend to stick away from drinking caffeine before i play

an energy drink is nothing different from a suggested coffee its the same effect there isnt anything magical about them caffeine is a component of most pre workout blend so yes it not unusual to feel like that but it very person dependent

for me a can of energy drink help with drowsiness after long work day before squash or having to wake stupid early for a league game if i wa not playing squash i would not even feel it its not caffeine only partially sugar if anything it more reminds of poison alert drinking 6 can or more back to back only lead to stomach pain but not some hyperactive state

i wa 2 year old when my mom died my sister wa five and a half i remember absolutely nothing my sister ha vivid but fragmented memory of it about four year later my dad had the idea of going on a two week camping trip in the dakotas wyoming minnesota and montana it wa our first real trip a a family unit without my mom when we were still sort of finding our identity a a trio and searching for a way forward with our life for me it basically where my narrative in life pick up to a kid that age a two week camping trip wa like a lifetime by day three i thought this wa just our new reality nomad bouncing from one koa and national park campground to the next i dont really remember specific but the imagery of that trip is completely burned into my brain a lurid and intensely beautiful dream that forever shaped my understanding of the world i remember crawling the dusty slope of the badlands and scooting my butt down a hill because i wa afraid of falling and wearing a hole through my short from sliding the whole way down to the bottom i remember trying to buy a pet rock at a gift shop and being deeply disappointed when my dad refused and told me to just name a rock i found at the campsite and it made everything better i remember trying to climb the base of devils tower before realizing that the sheer cliff wall wa more than i could handle i remember the campground that night nearby with the towering pine forest and the biker rally that we shared the campground with that night and how they let me sit on their harleys and rev the engine and the way dozen of people gathered around our campfire that night a my dad sang and played guitar i remember little big horn and squinting at the horizon a i imagined sitting bull and crazy horse lying in wait beyond the ridge i remember another gift shop where dad let me get a giant black rubber bowie knife with a sheathe and six shooter cap gun with holster that i treasured and wore on my belt for the rest of the trip i remember a buffalo walking up to our car at yellowstone and being struck dumb at it sheer size i remember a dozen sunset each more magnificent and colorful than the last and a couple sunrise when i woke up to take a pee and found myself staring off into the sky entranced by the great dome of emptiness above me i wa maybe six year old it changed me forever impressing a love of camping and wild country in my very soul my sister and i made a scrap book of newspaper article park pamphlet advertisement flower and other plant clipping and diary entry i never wanted it to end we would do another trip like it to colorado new mexico utah and arizona two year later a year after that we would go to maine and canada before i wa ten i had seen thing some people have to wait until their retirement to see some of the greatest natural wonder and most beautiful landscape in the world i absolutely remember them and wouldnt trade it for the world
